intro: Iris grijsii, commonly known as the gray iris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers with a distinctive white or pale yellow center. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, grass-like leaves that are often covered in a fine, powdery coating. Iris grijsii prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or alpine settings. Its blooming period occurs in late spring to early summer, adding a splash of color to its natural habitat.
